column4: Or pay a few bucks for a new drive for all the trouble it's worth ;)
I wouldn't know where to start with your issue, per se, but I would suggest not including spaces in any parent subdirectories... just in case.
I already moved it to /home/myname/position to avoid spaces in folder names such as My Documents etc
I have been trying to figure this out for hours
just remember, almost everything MS has in Windows was stolen or bought from someone else and then bloated by MS so if ya look at it that way...it's all old news anyway
